page.title: 06Charlotte Street Market
page.content: Although more recently named after George III's wife, it{dates from 1184, when Richard I gave a grant for a market in Old Portsmouth.{From c.1750, this street has been the market place It is now overshadowed by a concrete car park, which adds to the untidy appearance already created by crushed boxes and vegetables. The market has an average of{60 stalls,}of which most are wooden carts. The market days are{Tuesday,Thursday and{Saturday,}when shoppers can buy {meat, fruit and vegetables}etc. The market is a profitable business: the costs per site are Â£3.00 for the set market days and Â£1.10 for any extra days. The most important and costly problem is keeping the street clean. -Alexander Paterson -Roland Bliss Portsmouth Grammar School
